intro: Diasperus hirtellus, commonly known as the hairy spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in complex inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to dry conditions. Its latex is toxic and can cause skin irritation, which is a common characteristic among members of the spurge family.
